title: 'Really worthy Mouse for the price
rating: but has a few downsides while considering its for "gaming"....'
body: '4.0 out of 5 stars'
column5: First impressions: First of all, the mouse is awesome for the price 250 rupees. The mouse's quality was above my expectations. The packaging was done quite well.  Features: This mouse features 4 extra buttons (Two on the side and two behind the scroll wheel) other than the usual 3 buttons (Left, right and scroll click) The scroll wheel is pretty good too! There are 5 DPI modes. RGB Modes are customizable but there are some bugs in the software. The sensor on this mouse comes with a max poling rate of 125-130Hz which gets the job done in most games but for intense games it puts you in a disadvantage in the play. There are many other good mice, if you prefer higher poling rate like the Razer Deathadder Essential. This mouse comes with a normal USB-A pin and a braided cable.  Others: This mouse is best for palm grip users, but for finger and claw grip users this could be an option but, there are other good mice out there. This mouse is well suitable to medium size hands.  Few downsides that I found: I have medium sized hands. Due to the prensence of side buttons on the left side of the mouse, the area for the thumb decreases and sometimes results in misclicks during the usage. (While writing this review I reloaded the amazon page accidentally and all the progress was lost due to the side buttons) The poling rate is low, which is not suitable for everyone and every game. The mouse comes with a CD driver to install the mouse software. But, nowadays most laptops don't come with a CD slot. I had to visit their website for the drivers.  Pros for Minecraft players: This mouse is great for PVP and bridging too! First of all, this mouse can DOUBLE CLICK though it has optical switches! This mouse can drag click (about 16-20 cps easily), Jitter click (10-12 cps) and butterfly click (15-18 cps) comfortably!  Overall, I feel like this mouse is suitable for most games and work too. Hope this review helps, Cheers!

title: 'Guys Stop here !'
body: In one line, if you want to use software of it than change your mind and another one like Redgear A-17  1. Build quality wise it's seems very durable, it has a premium finish also  2. All features works perfectly  But but There is a very big problem, it doesn't have a chip inside, it didn't remember any settings or preferences. Every time you plug out mouse or reboot your system it sets to default configurations of 600 dpi and other settings. It's very annoying to all time configure settings before use.  If you want to configure everytime you want to use, than go for it or Get better one , eg.- Redgear A-17
